results.title: [Chinese theatre]
results.creator_credit: Victoria Mercanton, Marc Maurette, Theodora Olembert, Procinex and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: Episodes are performed by a Peking theatrical company which portray some Chinese legends and symbols; “Trouble in Heaven”, “The Legend of the King and the monkeys”, “The Greatness of love”, “Story of the beautiful white fairy”, “Where the roads meet”, “A Case of mistaken identity” and finally “Autumn River”.

results.title: [Chinese jade carving]
results.brief_description: The art of jade carving is a specialised and revered art in China. The film shows a skilled carver fashioning a rabbit out of jade. The five fundamental steps of jade carving as well as the tools used are demonstrated and described. The artistic and aesthetic values of jade are discussed and various properties of the material explained.

results.title: [Childrens' compilation]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Animation Studios and Walton Films
results.brief_description: A compliation of four short animated films for children. The titles are “Aladdin and his lamp”, “It’s the circus part 2”, “Puppy love” and “The Charging bull”. “Aladdin and his lamp” A puppet version of Aladdin and his magic lamp. “It’s the circus part 2” Bertram Mills Circus featuring live action horses, trapeze artists, chimps, clowns and lion tamers. “Puppy love” Mickey visits his sweetheart Minnie, presenting her with gifts. As he courts her, Mickey’s dog Pluto attempts to woo Minnie’s dog by presenting her with a gift intended for Minnie. Pluto exchanges Minnie’s gift with a bone. “The Charging bull” A charging bull tries to bowl over Mickey Mouse. Mickey’s automobile defends him and Minnie.

results.title: [Chicken: international cuisine]
results.brief_description: A very short animated film illustrating traditional chicken dishes from various countries. Each dish represented is announced in its national language - each nationality exists in multicultural Canada.

results.title: [Ch'u Fou: birthplace of Confucius]
results.brief_description: Documentary film about Ch’u Fou, Shantung Province, the birthplace of K’ung-Fu-Tze (Confucius, 551-478 B.C.). Examples of the architecture, art and sculpture of this period are shown including the Chinese Classroom, built many centuries later in dedication to the memory of Confucius and his democratic ideal of a classless education. Temples, stone carvings and ancient Chinese culture are luxuriously presented in this historically informative film. English language, Chinese title and credits.

results.title: [Caulfield Technical College Annual Review, 1966]
results.brief_description: An example of student film making. The surfer, riding a child’s tricycle with his surfboard under his arm, enters a park, splashes across an ornamental pond and land-surfs under a sprinkler. No title, no credits available.

results.title: [Cattle breeding in UK]
results.brief_description: Showing off bulls of various cattle in UK. These animals are specifically bred to withstand extreme climatic conditions and to fend for themselves either in UK or other countries like South America. Breeds shown include: Herefords Devon, Aberdeen Angus and Shorthorns. The Shorthorns are bred for beef and milk. Short snippet of King George, Queen Elizabeth and the two princesses at a cattle show.

results.title: [Calandra Kidd]
results.brief_description:
People and fish swim off and arounds rocks at the beach. One swimmer eats some food and proceeds to sunbathe.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [By Jupiter]
results.creator_credit: Jack Tilles and Wilding Picture Productions
results.brief_description: The film approaches the universal problem of improving the attitude of man to man. Shows how the attitude of a person reacts upon the people whom he meets in his way to work - first, when he is angry and, secondly, when he uses consideration to accomplish his ends.
